ins: Peel and finely grate the ginger. Wash the lemon well and rub the peel
Mix the soft margarine with the sugar. Put in the flour, baking powder, ginger and lemon peel and process it into a paste
Form balls with your hands (about 2.5 cm ∅) and put on a baking sheet with parchment paper, leaving a little distance. Press the balls flat with a fork
Set the oven to 170 °C and place them in the middle for 13 minutes, then take the ginger biscuits from the baking tray and leave them to cool

id: Flower Sprouts with Baked Potatoes and Sauce with Dried Tomatoes
ins: Peel potatoes and cut into 2 cm thick slices. Combine potatoes with olive oil and salt, mix well (eg, in a bowl shake - with lid/plate)
Place potatoes on a baking sheet with parchment paper and bake in preheated oven at 180 °C for ~25 minutes gold brown
Peel the onion and garlic, cut both into small cubes. Also cut dried tomatoes into cubes
Heat coconut oil in a pan and sauté the onions for 2 minutes. Add garlic and dried tomatoes and sauté also for 2 minutes
Add the tomato paste, mustard, salad herbs and peppercorns. Stir briefly and deglaze with boiling water
Stir in sweet lupine flour well and briefly boil everything together
Depending on your preference add some water or let the sauce simmer until the desired consistency is reached. Season with a pinch of salt if necessary
Wash Flower Sprouts and simmer in boiling water for 4 minutes, then remove

id: Shiitake Soup with Parsley and Mixed Herbs
ins: Clean shiitake mushrooms and cut into strips, peel and chop garlic, chop parsley coarsely
Heat a pot and melt the coconut oil. Sauté shiitake mushrooms and garlic briefly
Vegetable broth, parsley, peppercorns and salad herbs add. Simmer for ~10 minutes

id: Grated Kohlrabi Salad with Beetroot, Carrot, Cucumber and Sprouts
ins: Mix well soy yogurt together with all the herbs, salt, rapeseed oil and agave syrup
Peel and chop the shallot
Peel kohlrabi, carrots and beetroot and grater coarsely all together with the cucumber (alternatively: chop coarsely and blend briefly)
Mix everything well and serve with the sprouts
Cut smoked tofu into small pieces
Heat coconut oil in the pan, roast tofu with curry paste briefly and then remove
Chop thawed spinach and parsley separated, clean mushrooms and halve or quarter them
Sauté spinach in a pan with some coconut oil for ~5 minutes, stirring occasionally and finally remove
Melt coconut oil in a pot and add flour all at once whisking vigorously. Stir occasionally until the roux gets light brownish
Deglaze roux with vegetable broth and add all ingredients, simmer for 5 minutes
Peel onion and garlic, chop both and sauté in a pan with coconut oil
Cut tofu into stripes, remove the stalk of the canned tomatoes and cut into small pieces
Put tomatoes together with the peppercorns, oregano and salt in the pan, simmer for 5 minutes, stir occasionally
Coarsely chop coriander and add together with the tofu in the sauce, simmer for a further ~ 7 minutes, stir occasionally

id: Braised baby lettuce with walnuts and fine lemon dressing
ins: Mix the soy yogurt with agave syrup, salt, pepper and the juice of the lemon
Halve walnuts into quarters, garlic and roast both in a pan over medium heat, then remove
Wash baby lettuce and halve lengthwise - including the stem! Drain and stew the cut surface in a pan with olive oil for ~5 minutes, until they are golden brown

id: Fried Broccoli with Sun-Dried Tomatoes and Cashew Nuts
ins: Mix all ingredients together in a jar of sauce
Cut broccoli into florets and sun dried tomatoes into quarters
Fry cashew nuts in a frying pan and remove
Heat sesame oil in a pan and add plenty of broccoli and sear by stirring for 3 minutes
Mix in the sun dried tomatoes, cashew nuts and sauce and sauté all for 2 minutes while stirring well
Put powdered sugar, almonds, hazelnuts, cinnamon and orange zest into a bowl and quickly mix it.
Add water and lemon juice and work all of it into a dough. Even if it looks as if there were not enough fluids, hand knead your dough.

Roll out the dough at approx. 1cm thickness on a floury surface, cut out the forms you'd like - traditionally stars - and put those on a tray (covered with baking paper). Let the cookies dry for approx. 2 hours
Place the baking tray in the middle of the oven and bake at 200 °C for approx. 8 minutes

Create a thick icing from the remaining powdered sugar and water and cover the baked cookies with it. You can do this with the backside of a spoon - but it is better and quicker if you dip the top of your cookies into the icing real quick and remove the dripping icing with a palette knife. Let the icing dry completely prior to stacking your cinnamon stars!
Cut in maroni shell crosswise with a knife, so they do not burst in the oven
Bake on a baking sheet in a preheated oven at 180 °C for ~18 minutes
Cut in maroni shell crosswise with a knife, so they do not burst in the oven
Bake on a baking sheet in a preheated oven at 180 °C for ~18 minutes
Cut in maroni shell crosswise with a knife, so they do not burst in the oven
Bake on a baking sheet in a preheated oven at 180 °C for ~18 minutes
Cut in maroni shell crosswise with a knife, so they do not burst in the oven
Bake on a baking sheet in a preheated oven at 180 °C for ~18 minutes
